questions.question: Have you …………….. the fee yet?
questions.description: You pay for something that is bought.

questions.question: Samuel ……………… my drinks.
questions.description: You pay for something that is bought.

questions.question: They ……………. the house but they could not find the weapon.
questions.description: When search is used without for, it means ‘look everywhere in/on’.

questions.question: What are you ………………….. in my room?
questions.description: To search for is to look for.

questions.question: When we ……………… the church everybody stopped talking.
questions.description: Enter is used without a preposition when it means ‘enter a place’.

questions.question: We have just ………………… an agreement with them.
They spent the whole afternoon ……………… music and movies.
questions.description: Discuss is used without a preposition.

questions.question: We had a long ………………. money.
questions.description: The noun discussion is followed by the preposition about.

questions.question: Don’t ……………… money.
questions.description: To ask for is to ask somebody to give something.

questions.question: Don’t ………………. her her name.
questions.description: Ask without for means ask somebody to tell something.

questions.question: You must not ………….. a word he says.
questions.description: Believe is used without for when it means accept as true.

questions.question: Do you ………………… life after death?
questions.description: To believe in something is to believe that it exists.
